general_info.summary: This document provides a comprehensive overview of Sharda University's programs and schools, including the School of Dental Sciences, School of Medical Sciences & Research, and Sharda School of Nursing Science & Research. It details various university functions and reports such as Examination Annual Reports, Academic Bank of Credits, Curricula Feedback, and the University Brochure. The text also highlights aspects of university life and development, including its perspective plan, leadership, history, statutory bodies, tenders, and relevant acts. Furthermore, it touches upon health services like Family & Couple Counselling Services, capacity development initiatives, skill enhancement programs, language and communication skills, soft skills, entrepreneurship and innovation, and media presence through FM Radio. The document also mentions international connections with Sharda University Uzbekistan and Agra, updates on COVID-19, and initiatives related to human values, professional ethics, and cyber crime reporting.

career_path.summary: This text outlines the application process and career prospects following a course in basic sciences. It details potential career paths including higher education in India and abroad, government and private sector jobs in agriculture and research, and entrepreneurship, mentioning specific organizations and roles such as scientist, professor, and research and development manager.
career_path.raw_content:
How to apply for the course?
Career path you can choose after the course
Higher education in India and Abroad, Government and Private jobs (Agriculture, Sports Authority of India, Central & State Research Institute and Universities, Research Associate, scientist, Production Officer, Research & Development Manager, Professor, Ranbaxy, Biocon, Elly Illy, Zydus, Diagnostic Labs) Entrepreneurship, etc.
Take the next step towards a career in basic sciences.

other_services.summary: The provided text appears to be a list of various departments, services, initiatives, and resources offered by an organization, possibly a university. It covers areas such as recruitment, banking, postal services, strategic planning, leadership, history, statutory bodies, tenders, legal acts, health initiatives (COVID19, medical insurance), skill enhancement programs in language and soft skills, innovation, entrepreneurship, international student services (Visa and FRO/FRRO guidelines), and a mentoring portal called Paramarsh.
